CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 21, 1939, pg. 7, reads: ""Tickets To Cabaret Going Fast", Say These D.A.T.'S - Tickets for the Debs About Town Cabaret are in hands of the lovely members, some of whom are pictured above. They declare that, judging from the response of their many friends, tickets are going like hot cakes for their annual charity effort at Harlem Casino Friday, October 27. Back row, left to right: Beatrice Posey, Roslyn Lindsay, Helen Douglass, Adah Moore, Ruth Buchanan, and Eloise Robinson. Middle row: Romaine Denning, Louise Barnett, Joyce Roberts, Ethelmae Cole, Dorothy Garrison, and Alyce Lindsay.  Sitting: Jean Camblor, Lydia Taylor, Emilie Hamilton, Barbara Jones, and Dorothy Grigsby. - Harris photo." Also published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 25, 1941, pg. 8, with cutline: "'Tickets...for the Sweethearts Ball' that's all one can hear these days as the attractive Debs About Town prepare to pack 'em in at Duquesne Gardens, February 12th, with Jimmie Lunceford and his band playing the music.  They are also sponsoring a contest for 'Miss Sweetheart,' when the winner will be chosen by acclamation...."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of members of Debs About Town, back row from left: Beatrice Posey, Roslyn Lindsay, Helen Douglass, Adah Moore, Ruth Buchanan, Eloise Robinson; middle row: Romaine Denning, Louise Barnett, Joyce Roberts, Ethelmae Cole, Dorothy Garrison, Alyce or Alice Lindsay; seated: Jean Camblor, Lydia Taylor, Emilie Hamilton, Barbara Jones, and Dorothy Grigsby, posed outdoors, another version
